meanings.definition: Continuing firmly or obstinately in a course of action in spite of difficulty or opposition.
meanings.sent1: The persistent student never gave up on solving the challenging math problem.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her persistent efforts in achieving her goals.
meanings.sent3: The persistent squirrel kept trying to reach the bird feeder, even after falling multiple times.
meanings.sent4: His persistent knocking on the door finally caught the attention of the sleeping homeowner.
meanings.sent5: The persistent rain soaked through the umbrella, showing no signs of stopping.

meanings.definition: Continuing to exist or endure over a prolonged period.
meanings.sent1: The persistent smell of fresh cookies lingered in the kitchen all day.
meanings.sent2: The old building showed signs of persistent wear and tear.
meanings.sent3: Despite his persistent complaints, the broken toy car remained untouched on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The persistent sound of waves crashing against the shore was calming to the ears.
meanings.sent5: The persistent rumors about the upcoming event spread throughout the town.
